gurmukhi: hoie rhy ibsmY sB gop sunI hir ky muK qy jb swKI ]igAwn jnwvr kI leI bwj hÍY gÍwrn kwnH geI jb cwKI ]348]
transliteration: Hoe Rahe Bismai Sabh Gop Sounidar(i) Ke Moukh Te Jab Saakhee|| Giaan Janaavat Kilaibaaj Hvai Gvaaran Kaahn Gadjab Chaakhee||348||
translation: All the gopas listening to this from the mouth of Krishna wondered; when the gopis came to know about this amorous play of Krishna, they were also enlightened.348.

gurmukhi: AMjl jor sBY biRj ky jn koit pRnwm krY hir Awgy ]BUl geI sB ko mGvw suD kwnH hI ky rs BIqr pwgy ]
transliteration: Anjal Jor Sabhai Brij Ke Jan Kot Pranaam Darai Har(i) Aage|| Bhool Gadsabh Ko Maghvaa Sudh Kaahn Hihe Ras Bheetar Paage||
translation: All began to bow before Krishna with folded hands; everyone forgot Indra and were dyed in the love of Krishna;

gurmukhi: sovq Qy ju pry ibKmY sB DXwn lgy hir ky jn jwgy ]Aaur suD BUl sBo iek kwnH hI ky rs mY Anurwgy ]349]
transliteration: Anjal Jor Sabhai Brij Ke Jan Kottee Pranaam Darai Har(i) Ke Jan Jaage|| Aur Sudh Bhool Sabho Ik Kaahn Hike Ras Mai Anuraage||349||
translation: Those who were sleeping, having indulged in evil deeds, they all awoke and began to meditate on the Lord. They forgot all other consciousness and were absorbed in Krishna.349.

gurmukhi: kwnH khI sB ko his kY imil Dwm clo joaU hY hirqw AG ]nMd clXo blB`dR clXo jsuDw au clI nMdlwl ibnw nG ]
transliteration: Kaahn Kahisabh Ko Has(i) Kai Mil(i) Dhaam Chalo Jooo Hai Hiritaa Agh|| Nand Chadyo Balbhadra Chadyo Jasudhaa U Chalinand-laal Binaa Nagh||
translation: Krishna, who is the destroyer of the sins of all, said smilingly to all, “All of you may go home,” Yashoda, Nand, Krishna and Balbhadra, all becoming sinless, went to their homes;

gurmukhi: pUj jbY ienhU n krI qbhI kuipE ien pY Drqw pRG ]bydn m`D khI ien BIm qy mwir frXo Cl so pqvw mG ]350]
transliteration: Pooj Jabai Inhoo Na Karitab-hikoupio In Pai Dhartaa Pragh|| Bedan Maddh Kahiin Bheem Te Daar(i) Daryo Chhal So Patvaa Magh||350||
translation: When they not worship Indra, he became furious and bore his Vajra; there is a detailed description of Indra’s power and deceit in Vedass.350.

gurmukhi: BU suq so lr kY ijnhU nv swq Cufwie leI brmM|w ]Awid s`q jug ky mur ky gV qor dey sB ijau kc bM|w ]
transliteration: Bhoo Sout So Lar Kai Jinhoo Nav Saat Chhudaae Laibarmanad|| Ood (i) Satt Joug Ke Mur Ke Gad Tor Dae Sabh Jio Kach Banad||
translation: Krishna, who fighting with Bhumasura, saved sixteen thousand women, who in Satyuga had shattered the citadels like the bangled of glass,

gurmukhi: hY krqw sB hI jg ko Aru dyvn hwr iehI jug sM|w ]lokn ky piq so mq mMd ibbwd krY mGvw mq lM|w ]351]
transliteration: Hai Kartaa Sabh Hijag Ko Ar(u) Devan Haar Ihijoug Sanad|| Lokan Ke Pat(i) So Mai Mand Bibaad Darai Maghvaa Mat Lanad||351||
translation: He is virtually the Creator and the Sustainer of the whole universe; Indra of low intellect, is trying to quarrel with him.351.

gurmukhi: gopn sO iKJ ky mGvw qij kY mn AwnMd kop rcy ]sMg myGn jwie khI brKo biRj pY rs bIr m`iD gcy ]
transliteration: Gopan Sau Khijh Ke Maghvaa Taj(i) Kai Man Aanand Kop Rache|| San Meghan Jaae Kahibarkho Brij Pai Ras Beer Maddh(i) Gadhe||
translation: Annoyed with the gopas and forsaking his peace of mind, being in great fury, Indra asked the clouds, “All of you may go, shower with full force the rain on Braja;

gurmukhi: krIXo brKw ieqnI aun pY ijh qy Puin gop n eyk bcy ]sB BYnn BRwqn qwqn paUqRn qau An mwrhu swQ ccy ]352]
transliteration: Dareeyo Barkhaa Intnioun Pai Jih Te Phoun(i) Gop Na Ek Bache|| Sabh Bhainan Bhraatan Taatan Paootran Tau An Daroh Saath Chache||352||
translation: “Shower so much rain, that not even one gopa may survive and all the brothers, sisters, fathers, sons, grandsons and uncles all may perish.”352.

gurmukhi: Awies mwn purMdr ko ApnY sB myGn kwC su kwCy ]Dwie cly biRj ky mrby khu Gyr dso ids qy Gn AwCy ]
transliteration: Oois Maan Purandar Ko Apani Sabh Meghan Kaadhh Su Kaadhhe|| Dhaae Chale Brij Ke Marbe Kaoub Gher Daso Dis Te Ghan Aachhe||
translation: Getting the orders of Indra, all the clouds started towards Braja for besieging and devastating Braja; they went to kill the cows and calves,
